programme.title: Insane Pools: Off the Deep End
programme.desc: Lucas builds a giant pool for a friend. He creates a dream backyard with a dock, large cascading waterfalls, firepit and an audio-visual entertainment bar you can swim up to

programme.title: Insane Pools: Off the Deep End
programme.desc: On his first collaboration with a local design team, Lucas creates a tropical oasis. It features an island, a huge grotto rock and a Tiki-themed cabana

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete Nelson shares some of his favourite Treehouse Masters moments, including some previously lost footage

programme.title: Bad Dog!
programme.desc: A dog digs large ditches in its owners back garden and they need a bulldozer to fill them in. Plus, goats run amok at a birthday party and a canine steals underwear

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: How do dogs tell time? What is the secret behind the kangaroos hop? Plus, why do vultures fly in circles? Experts answer these questions!

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: Amazing animal facts, including how cats always land on their feet, hummingbirds ability to fly when it is raining and a subterranean mammals secret to longevity

programme.title: Little Giants

programme.title: Little Giants

programme.title: Fish or Die

programme.title: Saved by the Barn
programme.desc: The staff join forces with a charity to find homes for four neglected calves. A litter of piglets are born and Chris builds a playground for the goats

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: The ranch faces another crisis when the water supply freezes. Elsewhere, the Wolfpack must problem solve to get the house back on track in time for the deep freeze

programme.title: Lone Star Law

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet

programme.title: Wildlife on One
programme.sub-title: African Penguin: Cool Bird in a Hot Spot
programme.desc: The invasion of Cape Town by penguins in 1984 paved the way for others to breed on the African mainland, despite the blazing sunshine and human presence. David Attenborough reveals the interdependence of these birds, which choose a new home each year on the offshore islands or in town

programme.title: Jane Goodall: Beauty and the Beasts
programme.desc: In 1960, a young secretary from Bournemouth, with no scientific qualifications, entered a remote forest in Africa and achieved something nobody else had ever done before. Jane Goodall became accepted by a group of wild chimpanzees, making discoveries that transformed the understanding of humans closest relatives. This programme reveals the person behind the myth, looking at what motivates her and the personal cost her lifes work has exacted from her

programme.title: Wogan
programme.sub-title: Jane Goodall, Ade Edmondson and Eurythmics
programme.desc: Terry Wogan chats to conservationist Jane Goodall and comedian Ade Edmondson, and presents music by the Eurythmic. Plus, an interview via satellite with Parker from Thunderbirds. First broadcast in 1986

programme.title: A Choral Pilgrimage with the Sixteen
programme.desc: Hannah French presents a concert from Peterborough Cathedral, with Harry Christophers conducting choral ensemble the Sixteen in music from across nine centuries. Featuring choral music on the theme of peace by Hildegard of Bingen, Anna Clyne, John Taverner, Will Todd and Arvo Part

programme.title: Lord Mervyn King Remembers - The Age of Uncertainty
programme.desc: The former governor of the Bank of Englandlooks back on the BBCs 1977 series on the history of economic thinking, which was written and presented by the highly influential economist and intellectual John Kenneth Galbraith. The series tackled the challenge of bringing economics to a mainstream audience, seemingly sparing no expense in its use of actors, elaborate sets and multiple international locations. Lord King gives an assessment of the series five decades on from its original transmission, sharing his opinion of Galbraith and his methods, and explaining why the series divided critics at the time

programme.title: The Age of Uncertainty
programme.sub-title: The Prophets and Promise of Classical Capitalism
programme.desc: John Kenneth Galbraith looks at the history of economic thinking, beginning with the men who laid the foundations, including Adam Smith, David Ricardo and Thomas Malthus. First broadcast in 1977

programme.title: The Age of Uncertainty
programme.sub-title: The Manners and Morals of High Capitalism
programme.desc: John Kenneth Galbraith looks at the ideas that sustained the rich in the 19th century and how they still affected attitudes in the 1970s. First broadcast in 1977

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Appealing to both adults and children alike, Philip Pullmans books have sold more than 20 million copies and been translated into 40 languages, with his recent novel La Belle Sauvage becoming an instant best-seller. Alan Yentob spends time with the author in Oxford, discovering how the former teacher became an acclaimed writer of fantasy fiction - and an outspoken critic of organised religion

programme.title: A Choral Pilgrimage with the Sixteen
programme.desc: Hannah French presents a concert from Peterborough Cathedral, with Harry Christophers conducting choral ensemble the Sixteen in music from across nine centuries. Featuring choral music on the theme of peace by Hildegard of Bingen, Anna Clyne, John Taverner, Will Todd and Arvo Part

programme.title: Jane Goodall: Beauty and the Beasts
programme.desc: In 1960, a young secretary from Bournemouth, with no scientific qualifications, entered a remote forest in Africa and achieved something nobody else had ever done before. Jane Goodall became accepted by a group of wild chimpanzees, making discoveries that transformed the understanding of humans closest relatives. This programme reveals the person behind the myth, looking at what motivates her and the personal cost her lifes work has exacted from her

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Building of Britain
programme.desc: The former steeplejack considers building designs of the 19th century. He visits Eastnor Castle in Herefordshire to examine the work of architect Robert Smirke, then travels to St Giless Church in Cheadle, Staffordshire, to study the Gothic-inspired designs of Augustus Pugin

programme.title: The Channel Tunnel - Life on the Inside
programme.desc: A look at the first round of testing for shuttle drivers, which has a 90 per cent fail rate, while supercars arrive in convoy for the Le Mans 24-hour race

programme.title: Stolen: Catching the Art Thieves
programme.desc: Documentary featuring first-hand accounts of Europes most daring art heists, beginning with the theft of JMW Turners Shade and Darkness and Light and Colour in 1994 from the Schirn gallery in Frankfurt. The paintings were on loan from the Londons Tate and the invetsigation into the heist led to a high-stakes game of cat and mouse across Europe, from London to Belgrade deep into the world of Serbian warlords

programme.title: Call My Bluff
programme.desc: Robert Robinson presides over a duel of words and wits between Frank Muir, Jilly Cooper and Quentin Bell and Patrick Campbell, Lesley-Anne Down and Anthony Valentine. First broadcast in 1976

programme.title: Face the Music
programme.desc: Joseph Cooper invites viewers to match their musical wits against panellists Patricia Owen, John Julius Norwich and David Attenborough. With guest musician Imogen Cooper. First broadcast in 1975

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: Ian Holm narrates a 1983 profile of the Hollywood star, spanning her life and career from the 1920s to the 1980s, on stage and on screen, and including an interview with Davis herself

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: Documentary charting jazz musician George Mellys visit to the Hayward Gallery in 1978, where he examines the works on show in a major exhibition on Dada and surrealism. He also talks to some of the last English followers of the movement, including Roland Penrose, before meeting up with rock band the Stranglers

programme.title: The Great Philosophers
programme.desc: Bryan Magee and guest Bernard Williams discuss the work of French philosopher Rene Descartes

programme.title: The Great Philosophers
programme.desc: Bryan Magee is joined by Anthony Lord Quinton to discusses the work of Dutch philosopher Baruch Spinoza and German philosopher Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Building of Britain
programme.desc: The former steeplejack considers building designs of the 19th century. He visits Eastnor Castle in Herefordshire to examine the work of architect Robert Smirke, then travels to St Giless Church in Cheadle, Staffordshire, to study the Gothic-inspired designs of Augustus Pugin

programme.title: The Channel Tunnel - Life on the Inside

The paintings were on loan from the Londons Tate and the invetsigation into the heist led to a high-stakes game of cat and mouse across Europe, from London to Belgrade deep into the world of Serbian warlords

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Crystal Palace v Bournemouth at Selhurst Park, and Sunderland v Wolverhampton Wanderers at The Stadium of Light. Both of last seasons matches between the Eagles and Cherries finished in 0-0 draws, but with both teams getting off to a flying start in this campaign a more exciting match was anticipated. The Black Cats and Wolves were meeting in the top flight for the first time since the 2011/12 season, and the hosts were aiming to continue their excellent early-season form against their struggling visitors. Plus, Nottingham Forest v Chelsea, Brighton and Hove Albion v Newcastle United, Burnley v Leeds United, Manchester City v Everton, and Fulham v Arsenal

programme.title: Sunday with Laura Kuenssberg
programme.desc: Interviews with key politicians and public figures

programme.title: Sunday Politics Northern Ireland
programme.desc: Mark Carruthers presents the political developments of the week, with policy-makers questioned on the key issues

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Carla OBrien present topical debate, questioning whether the UK is ready to cope with the coming impact of climate change. Plus, a report on a conference discussing how to rebuild faith relationships in the UK, and a celebration of Diwali with some traditional dancing and music

programme.title: Prayer and Reflection
programme.desc: Friday evening Isha prayers from the Belfast Islamic Centre, the final of the five daily prayers in Islam. They take place after sunset, providing an opportunity for worshippers to reflect on their day and look ahead to the future

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt looks ahead to the celebration of Diwali with Tony Singh, Nisha Parmar and Seema Pankhania serving up celebratory recipes for guests Karenjeet Kaur Bains and Sonali Shah who share their memories from years gone by

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Pam Rhodes celebrates the 1,700-year anniversary of the Nicene Creed and explores why this ancient declaration of beliefs is so important in the history of Christianity. At the Coptic Orthodox Church Centre in Stevenage, Pam unpacks the background and impact of the Nicene Creed with Anba Angaelos, archbishop of the Coptic Orthodox Church, The Roman Catholic archbishop of Birmingham, Bernard Longley, and the former archbishop of Canterbury, Rowan Williams. With each representing a very different branch of the Church, they explore why the creed is such a powerful symbol of Christian Unity

programme.title: Points of View
programme.desc: Viewers opinions on BBC shows and behind-the-scenes reports on new programmes

programme.title: Lifeline
programme.desc: Richard Clifford presents this months Lifeline appeal on behalf of React, a charity dedicated to helping children with life shortening illnesses by providing specialist equipment and respite breaks for them and their families

programme.title: Blue Planet II
programme.desc: Footage of marine life in different environments around the world

programme.title: Hamzas Hidden Wild Isles
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Hamza Yassin reveals hidden wildlife gems from across the British Isles. In the spring, he encounters badgers, adders and nightingales. Hamza also heads to the Wirral to try and film one of the weirdest events in Britain. A high spring tide forces small mammals to leave their homes in the marsh and head to higher ground, providing a frenzy for a range of predators

programme.title: A Shaun the Sheep Movie: Farmageddon
programme.desc: When an alien with amazing powers crash-lands near Mossy Bottom Farm, Shaun the Sheep goes on a mission to shepherd the intergalactic visitor home before a sinister organisation can capture her. Animated comedy, with the voices of Justin Fletcher, John Sparkes and Amalia Vitale

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith, Matt Baker and Adam Henson are in Kent to explore the influence of France on the Garden of England as the Kent Downs National Landscape is on the verge of making history as part of what could become the worlds first UNESCO Cross-Channel Geopark, a unique project that would celebrate the geological and cultural links between Kent and northern France. Matt visits a Kentish vineyard and Charlotte heads to a wildlife reserve thats been created using the spoil from the Channel Tunnel excavation. Adam meets a farmer who raises French Charolais cattle

programme.title: Hamzas Hidden Wild Isles
programme.desc: Hamza Yassin records wildlife around the UK during summer, travelling from the vast open ocean of the Irish sea to the heart of Leeds and his remote home on Scotlands west coast. Along the way, he encounters a two-metre long blue shark, pregnant greater horseshoe bats, a pod of common dolphins, and wild beavers, which have been missing from Britain for the past 400 years

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.desc: Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman announce the results of the judges scores and viewers votes, with the two couples with the lowest combined scores taking part in a dance-off to decide who will be next to leave the contest. Plus, music by Leigh-Anne Pinnock and the professionals perform a fierce group tango

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents from the National Waterfront Museum in Swansea, where highlights include a rare, 19th-century photograph album capturing landmarks of Ancient Egypt and an Elton John signature brought in by one of the singers proteges. Fiona also explores Wales industrial and maritime heritage, visiting a collection charting Swanseas evolution from copper production through local coal mining to the early days of steam trains

programme.title: Riot Women
programme.desc: As Beth and Kitty become the Lennon and McCartney of the Riot Women, Jesss feud with rival Hebden bar owner Inez reignites. Nisha grapples with a toxic colleague, and Holly realises her mothers dementia is worsening. A high-octane first band rehearsal gives way to common ground, but as the women start to bond, a long-buried secret smacks Kitty in the face

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Tottenham Hotspur v Aston Villa at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium, and Liverpool v Manchester United at Anfield. Spurs battled back from a goal down to record a 4-1 victory in the corresponding clash against Villa last term, with Dominic Solanke bagging a second-half brace. Meanwhile, the Reds were looking for a first home win over the Red Devils since the 2022/23 season when they triumphed 7-0, with the two meetings since then ending in draws. Plus, a recap of the goals and talking points from Saturday

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Rock legend Bruce Springsteen and The Bear star Jeremy Allen White, who plays Bruce in Springsteen: Deliver Me from Nowhere join the host to discuss the biographical movie. Oscar-winner Jennifer Lawrence discusses her role in psychological drama Die My Love and Tessa Thompson reflects on taking the lead in Hedda, a bold re-imagining of Ibsens Hedda Gabler. Plus, Florence + the Machine perform the new single Everybody Scream

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Louise Minchin present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: How 21-year-old cadet Daniel Khalife broke out of Wandsworth Prison, provoking the largest manhunt in recent UK history

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin looks at a down-at-heel 1930s Nottingham bungalow thats been transformed into a modern, stylish house. Martel Maxwell and Jacqui Joseph report on developers in Workington, in Cumbria, and Gillingham, in Kent, as they work wonders on their auction buys

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents as two teams are challenged to scour an antiques fair and pick up bargains to sell for profit at auction in Heanor, Derbyshire. Best friends Lindsay and Joy on the red team, guided by Irita Marriott, are on the lookout for pottery, jewellery and gardenalia. Friends Hilary and Siobhan on the blue team, assisted by John Cameron, are hoping their enthusiasm and passion for antiques will help them win

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC Newsline; Weather
programme.desc: Local news worth watching from across Northern Ireland

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Trace, Track, Get My Car Back
programme.desc: Vehicle recovery specialist Richard is on the trail of a caravan thats been stolen during a late-night raid on a site in Nottingham. Tracker Joe hunts down a stolen Range Rover thats being dismantled for parts in a workshop

programme.title: Lost and Found in the Lakes
programme.desc: A couple search around Helvellyn for their toy Gonzo, a character from the TV sketch comedy The Muppet Show - which they have cherished as a beloved mascot for 50 years. After a damaged phone is found underwater, experts pull out all the stops to track down its owner. A local crafter makes a keepsake out of discarded items. Presented by Helen Skelton

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson heads to the Cumbrian countryside with a sporty couple chasing a fresh start, with plans for a carpentry business and plenty of outdoor adventures

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Experts restore an elephant puppet that survived a fire and is believed to have been part of the early BBC childrens programme Muffin the Mule, a Swiss timepiece that belonged to a Lancaster bomber pilot in the Second World War, a sign showing a lap record time from a race track in Scarborough and a hurling stick from the 1980s

programme.title: The Inner Circle
programme.desc: Amanda Holden hosts the quiz show where players must outsmart each other to win big. Six players are each randomly assigned a secret amount, anything between zero and £4,000. Each player only knows their own value before being thrown into a battle of wits, nerve, and strategic gameplay across a series of challenging rounds

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which four pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Trevor Nelson

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Alex Jones present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Nigel prepares to sell his beloved car, but accidentally damages it in the process. Later he makes a reckless decision that has serious consequences. George grows concerned about Kojos whereabouts, and Kat is consumed with worry for her family

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: The Race to Build 1.5 Million Homes
programme.desc: Anita Rani and Justin Rowlatt travel from South Tyneside to the Isle of Wight to find out if the Governments promise of building 1.5 million new homes in England by 2029 is practicable and if it will make housing more affordable. Along the way they discover the secret to making bricks, explore the complexity of the planning system and meet the new housing secretary

programme.title: Blue Lights
programme.desc: Grace offers up a secret about her own past in an attempt to connect to Lindsay. Aislings erratic behaviour forces Tommy to make a heartbreaking decision

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts, with guest panellists comedian Ross Noble and journalist Helen Lewis joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop. As usual, all concerned poke fun at the weeks headlines

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena pulls out all the stops with an elaborate date to win Vanessa back, determined to remind her of what they once shared, and as they reminisce, old feelings resurface. Maurice and Funmis romantic night out falls apart when they cant find a babysitter, forcing them to improvise at home - quietly, cautiously, and with one ear on the baby monitor. Over dinner, Errol finally works up the courage to ask Grace a big question - until Claude and Polly swoop in and ruin the mood. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: When network executive Pippa makes a surprise visit to the set of Sin and Subterfuge, Kwabena knows its his chance to prove he belongs in the directors chair. A flawless day could launch his career, but as one mishap spirals into another, he must rely on his charm and determination to keep the production afloat - and his dream within reach. When Maurice misses yet another nursery event for Mayowa, Funmi finds an unexpected ally in a fellow parent. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: When the long-awaited chance to direct Jamaica Road finally arrives, Kwabena faces one final obstacle - he needs Simons help. Needless to say, getting his support comes with big strings attached. A run-in with Vanessa and her new boyfriend hits Kwabena like a ton of bricks. Maurice is blindsided when he learns that Mayowa has a girlfriend - something he knew nothing about. The revelation stings, forcing him to ask if the sacrifices hes making to fund his sons future are costing him the present. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: A worrying situation escalates in Albert Square and Teddy and Gina grow concerned for Harry

programme.title: EastEnders

programme.title: The Celebrity Traitors

programme.title: The Celebrity Traitors

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: An offbeat look at the hideous history of health, from the invention of toilet paper to the healthy origins of the cornflake. Plus, how the Mayans believed that drinking urine could cure all ills, how the Tudors taught themselves how to swim again, how Victorians had a taste in beauty products that was literally shocking, and an in-depth look at Louis XIVs bottom problems

programme.title: Joe Swash: Forgotten Young Dads
programme.desc: Joe meets young dads who are navigating the highs and lows of fatherhood, looking back on his own experiences as a parent and sparking wider conversations about masculinity, the importance of positive male role models, and why its time for young dads to be seen, heard, supported - and celebrated. Reflecting on how becoming a father in his mid-twenties changed his life, he meets four young dads who, like he once did, are navigating the challenges of parenting and are determined to challenge stigma, overcome hardship and redefine what fatherhood looks like today

programme.title: P Diddy: The Rise and Fall

Yinka will examine how Combs made it to the top, and what some may have turned a blind eye to along the way. Speaking to some of Combs inner circle, and biggest critics, Yinka will find out what they think about him and ask why so many are only speaking out now

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabenas long-awaited break comes with Sin and Subterfuge, a radical colour-blind Regency drama. Meanwhile, Funmi and Maurice sharpen their airs and graces in a bid to secure Mayowa a place at the boroughs top nursery. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabenas first day on set finds him working with his hero, legendary actor Rudolph Williams. To make matters worse, Vanessa weighs heavily on his mind, after their run-in brings up feelings he struggles to ignore. The Brooklyn-Bells try to coax him back, but he refuses to return. Doug decides to make a mini swimming pool by filling the ball pit with cool water. Waffle loves swimming pools. programme.desc: Millions of workers in the UK could lose their jobs because of the artificial intelligence revolution. According to experts the impact on a range of industries could be dramatic, with skilled work particularly affected. As AI develops rapidly, with claims it can outperform humans in most tasks, Dispatches undertakes a bold and unique experiment that pitches human against machine to find out how true that is. Four professionals are invited into a specially-created test centre to compete in a set of identical tasks against their AI counterparts: a GP; a fashion photographer; a trainee solicitor; and a composer. With reputations as well as jobs at stake, who comes out on top - humans or AI?

programme.desc: Jacksonville Jaguars v Los Angeles Rams (Kick-off 2.30pm). Nat Coombs is joined by Osi Umenyiora to present coverage of the week seven match at Wembley Stadium. programme.title: Live: NFL Big Game Night

The Chiefs prevailed in both matches against their divisional rivals last season, including a 19-17 victory here that relied on a fourth-quarter field goal from Matthew Wright to spare their blushes and avoid a narrow defeat. programme.title: Fawlty Towers: A Very British Comedy
programme.desc: Created by John Cleese and Connie Booth, Fawlty Towers reached heights of popularity few shows at the time could rival. So, why does it only exist in a recut, sanitised and edited form, with some of the original scenes deleted? This programme looks at controversies surrounding the classic comedy, examining its sometimes uncomfortable place in the modern world, using deleted scenes and archival interviews to piece together the story of how a sitcom that seemed untouchable in the 1970s came to be viewed through a more critical lens

programme.desc: Documentary looking at the Duke of Edinburghs early life, his playboy father and troubled mother, and an immediate childhood connection that blossomed into a royal romance. Experts and insiders reveal his achievements in the face of danger as a sailor in the Second World War, and the extraordinary experience of fighting against his aristocratic German brothers-in-law. The programme also explores the extent of the sacrifices he made to marry Princess Elizabeth in 1947, giving up his Mediterranean titles, becoming a naturalised British citizen and devoting his life to the service of the crown, always in deference to his wife

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to Newbury Park in southern California to help Mexican restaurant Mama Ritas. Meanwhile, Mitch is certain Cam is undermining him during their kitchen renovation, and Jay is determined to get Gloria to admit she was in a car accident

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay expects validation for his contribution when Claire lands a big opportunity for Pritchetts Closets, while Luke and Alex stumble upon a successful online business

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge bumps her head while cleaning the kitchen and loses any recollection of Homer - who is forced to woo her all over again in a bid to re-establish their relationship and restore domestic bliss to the Simpson household

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy must decide whether or not to marry Sheldon and gives him an answer to his proposal. Howard and Bernadette struggle with some unexpected news. With guest stars Laurie Metcalf, Riki Lindhome and Stephen Hawking

programme.title: Great Indian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Jodhpur to Delhi, heading into the desert to take a camel ride to a village where life has changed little in centuries, before embarking on the Jaipur-Agra-Delhi Golden Triangle tour - Indias must-do itinerary in 1913 as today. Michael also visits Agra, where he learns how the Taj Mahal, built by a Mughal emperor, was restored by a British viceroy at the time of his Bradshaws guide book

programme.title: Great Indian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillos Bradshaws 1913 Handbook of Indian, Foreign and Colonial Travel leads him on railway journey through the modern south Indian states of Karnataka and Tamil Nadu. He travels from the former princely state of Mysuru, aka Mysore, to the first stronghold of the East India Company in Chennai, formerly Madras

programme.title: The SpongeBob Movie: Sponge Out of Water
programme.desc: The cheery sea creature tries to prevent a precious secret formula from falling into the wrong hands - but when it goes missing, the end of the world approaches. SpongeBob and his friends embark on a quest to get it back, which leads to them developing superpowers and venturing onto dry land. Animated comedy, with the voices of Tom Kenny and Antonio Banderas

programme.title: The Art of Racing in the Rain
programme.desc: Thanks to his race car driver owner, golden retriever Enzo learns that the techniques needed on the racetrack can also be used to successfully navigate the journey of life. Comedy drama, starring Milo Ventimiglia and Amanda Seyfried

programme.title: River of No Return
programme.desc: A homesteader and his son fall foul of a crooked gambler, who makes off with the farmers horse and rifle and leaves behind his abandoned girlfriend. However, the three of them are forced to flee by river on a raft when their farm comes under attack. Western, starring Robert Mitchum, Marilyn Monroe and Rory Calhoun

programme.title: Romancing the Stone
programme.desc: A romantic novelist goes in search of her kidnapped sister in the steamy jungles of South America, only to become the target of a villainous general who demands as a ransom the valuable treasure map in her possession. Help is at hand in the form of a craggy daredevil fortune hunter, who has his eye on a share of the profits. Comedy adventure, starring Michael Douglas, Kathleen Turner and Danny DeVito

programme.title: Home Alone
programme.desc: A boy has to fend for himself when he is accidentally left behind after his family jets off to Paris for Christmas. The youngster initially enjoys his freedom, but is soon forced to resort to ingenious booby traps to defend the family home from two dim-witted burglars. Comedy, starring Macaulay Culkin, Joe Pesci, Daniel Stern, John Heard, Catherine OHara and John Candy

programme.title: A Man Called Otto
programme.desc: A man whos given up on life following the loss of his wife and wants to end it all. When a young family moves in nearby, he meets his match in quick-witted Marisol, leading to a friendship that will turn his world around. Comedy drama, starring Tom Hanks, Mariana Trevino and Rachel Keller

programme.title: Military Wives
programme.desc: With their partners away serving in Afghanistan, a group of women on the home front form a choir and quickly find themselves at the centre of a media sensation and global movement. As unexpected bonds of friendship flourish, music and laughter transform their lives, helping them to overcome their fears for their loved ones in combat. Comedy drama, starring Kristin Scott Thomas, Sharon Horgan and Emma Lowndes

programme.title: The Future
programme.desc: A carefree couple prepare to adopt a stray cat, but realise this means they face being responsible for another creature for years to come. With the animal due to arrive in a month, they set out to have as many new experiences as they can in the time left, with unexpected repercussions for their relationship. Drama, directed by and starring Miranda July. With Hamish Linklater

programme.title: Ride Lonesome
programme.desc: A bounty hunter captures young killer Billy John, but his real motive is not the cash reward - he has an old score to settle with his prisoners brother Frank. As the journey to bring the murderer to justice gets under way, he is counting on a showdown with Frank and accepts the help of two outlaw gunmen for added protection, aware they will try to turn Billy John in themselves for the reward and a pardon. Western, with Randolph Scott, Lee Van Cleef, James Best, James Coburn and Pernell Roberts.

programme.title: They Rode West
programme.desc: A cavalry doctor is determined to help deal with a malaria epidemic on a Kiowa reservation. However, his fellow soldiers disapprove of his compassionate attitude, while the tribes medicine man resents outside interference. When the Native Americans attack the fort, the medic is branded a traitor. Western, starring Robert Francis, Donna Reed, May Wynn and Phil Carey

programme.title: Yesterdays Enemy
programme.desc: A British officer leading a patrol through the Burmese jungle during the Second World War uses brutal methods to gain vital intelligence from prisoners, to the outrage of a chaplain and war correspondent travelling with them. When the unit is captured by Japanese forces, he faces similar treatment at the hands of his captors. Drama, starring Stanley Baker, Guy Rolfe and Leo McKern.

programme.title: Tora! Tora! Tora!
programme.desc: Fact-based Second World War drama recounting the bombing of Pearl Harbour from both the Japanese and American perspectives, reconstructing the events leading up to the devastating attack on the US naval base in 1941. Starring Martin Balsam, So Yamamura, Joseph Cotten, James Whitmore and Jason Robards

programme.title: Sleepless in Seattle
programme.desc: A widowed father is coping badly with his wifes death, but his son is convinced that what he really needs is some new romance in his life. He arranges for his dad to go on a radio phone-in show, and his touching story moves a reporter to respond, even though she is already engaged. She returns to her fiance, but the boy, certain she is the woman for his father, plots to bring them together. Romantic comedy, with Tom Hanks and Meg Ryan

programme.title: Ticket to Paradise
programme.desc: Divorced couple David and Georgia fake civility for the sake of their daughter, Lily. During a post-graduation trip to Bali, Lily falls in love with a handsome local called Gede, and the young couple hastily decide to marry. With four days until the nuptials, David and Georgia secretly agree a truce to carry out an underhand plan to break up the couple so Lily doesnt make the same mistake as them. Director Ol Parkers comedy romance, starring George Clooney, Julia Roberts and Kaitlyn Dever

programme.title: Baby Ruby
programme.desc: A successful lifestyle entrepreneur is happily pregnant, awaiting the arrival of her first child. But soon after the birth, something starts to feel off, while seemingly perfect neighbourhood mothers become desperate to befriend her. She is plunged into a waking fever dream where everyone is a threat and nothing is as it seems. Psychological horror, starring Noemie Merlant and Kit Harington

programme.title: The Winter Guest
programme.desc: Recent widow Frances is determined to leave her Scotland home for Australia, but receives an unexpected visit from her mother, who is intent on changing her mind. Meanwhile, Frances son faces the prospect of his first sexual experience. Drama, directed by Alan Rickman, and starring Emma Thompson opposite her real-life mother Phyllida Law

programme.title: The High Chaparral

programme.title: The High and the Mighty
programme.desc: A pilot loses his nerve when one of his planes engines fails on a flight bound for San Francisco, leaving his washed-up co-pilot to fly the craft to safety and save the passengers lives. Disaster thriller based on the novel by Ernest K Gann, starring John Wayne, Claire Trevor, Laraine Day and Robert Stack

programme.title: Sabata

However, an implacable gunslinger is soon coming after them to dish out his own brand of justice. Spaghetti Western, starring Lee Van Cleef, William Berger and Pedro Sanchez. Dubbed in English

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: Two grieving widows lay rival claims to a corpse found washed up on the beach, each insisting it is the body of her missing husband. While it is obvious only one can be telling the truth, the detective finds it tricky to discern which of the women is lying - and why. Drama, guest starring Eleanor Bron, with Jack Shepherd

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Oxfords last-surviving all-female college is holding a reunion to bid farewell to one of its most prominent professors. However, the evening leads to tragedy when a guest is found murdered, and Lewis is convinced the killing is connected to an attack that occurred at the same institution 10 years previously. The detective calls in his former DS, Alison McLennan, to help with the investigation, but the case takes a twist when two more bodies turn up. Crime drama, guest starring Juliet Stevenson and Saskia Reeves, with Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: The residents celebrate Christmas 1919 with a lavish party, but tensions are rife and Batess arrest casts a shadow over the festivities. Mary has to consider her future with Sir Richard Carlisle following a disagreement at a shoot and Violet has concerns about Rosamund, whose new suitor - the dashing but raffish Lord Hepworth - is not all he seems. One-off festive special of the hit costume drama, guest starring Nigel Havers and Sharon Small, with Brendan Coyle, Michelle Dockery, Iain Glen, Maggie Smith and Samantha Bond

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Oscar-winning actress Shirley MacLaine joins the cast of the period drama as Coras mother Martha, who makes a grand entrance when she arrives at Downton for Matthew and Marys wedding. However, with the couple struggling to stay united as their big day looms, will Marthas Atlantic crossing have been for nothing? Meanwhile, Mr Carson runs the rule over new footman Alfred, and Robert receives news that could leave him facing the greatest crisis of his life - and plunge the rest of the household into chaos. Starring Hugh Bonneville, Maggie Smith, Jim Carter and Michelle Dockery

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: With the estates future hanging in the balance, Mary hopes to receive a bailout from her grandmother Martha - and with Violets help, tries to make sure Downton puts on a bigger show than ever before with a grand party for friends and neighbours. Meanwhile, Mrs Hughes hears worrying news, and OBriens efforts to boost Alfreds progress meets with disapproval from Thomas. Costume drama, starring Michelle Dockery, Shirley MacLaine and Maggie Smith

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Ediths big day finally arrives, but will her enthusiasm convince the family that Strallans age doesnt matter? Meanwhile, Mrs Hughes anxiously awaits her results, Anna makes a breakthrough to help Bates, and Mary takes matters into her own hands to secure the estates future - but the personal cost could be high. Costume drama, starring Laura Carmichael, Robert Bathurst, Phyllis Logan, Joanne Froggatt and Michelle Dockery

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Bransons political views land him in trouble and Sybils loyalty is tested to the limit, while Ethel makes a difficult decision about her sons future. Anna wonders what is causing Bates silence, and Carson begins recruiting a footman, with promising candidate Jimmy (Ed Speleers, Eragon) sparking immediate interest below stairs. Costume drama, starring Allen Leech, Jessica Brown Findlay, Amy Nuttall, Joanne Froggatt, Brendan Coyle and Jim Carter

programme.title: Agatha Christies Marple
programme.desc: A series of scandals makes for an interesting few days in the quiet village of St Mary Mead, and most seem to revolve around a blustering local colonel, whose brusque manner and short temper make him unpopular with his fellow villagers. When he is found dead with a bullet through the head, Miss Marple and the reluctant DI Slack investigate. Whodunit, starring Geraldine McEwan as Miss Marple, with Jane Asher, Jason Flemying, Derek Jacobi and Miriam Margolyes

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Scott investigate the death of a racehorse trainer and suspect an aristocratic familys troubled history holds the key to the mystery - until a second killing makes them think again. programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates when a seemingly beloved resident of a coastal community is fatally driven off the road, and realises she has to dig up the victims past to have any chance of unmasking the killer. Joined by her faithful team, including DC Kenny Lockhart and new recruit DC Jac Williams, Vera attempts to find the missing link that will crack the case, but finds it difficult to get to the truth when everyone they encounter seems to be protecting a secret. Crime drama based on Ann Cleeves series of novels, starring Brenda Blethyn

programme.title: The Hack
programme.desc: Investigative journalist Nick Davies receives an anonymous tip-off regarding Rupert Murdochs News of the World. Following the trail, he discovers damning evidence that proves phone hacking at the paper was not the work of one rogue reporter, as has been claimed for years but was endemic. Nick and his long-time editor and friend Alan Rusbridger decide to risk their careers and their newspaper to go up against one of the most powerful media organisations in the world. Drama, starring David Tennant and Toby Jones

programme.title: The Hack

As he is drawn deeper into the case, Dave finds himself under surveillance by the News of the World. When his private and work lives are put under pressure, Dave begins to pursue the case ruthlessly and takes up matters with Rebekah Wade, the News of the Worlds powerful editor

programme.desc: An investigation into a cattle auctioneer puts Mikes career in danger when he finds himself under suspicion of taking bribes. However, what Dr Ellinghams friends and family fail to realise is that he is actually trapped up at the Winton farm, where desperate wife Annie is trying to coerce him into performing a life-saving operation on her terminally ill husband Jim. programme.desc: Part one of two. Starring Kevin Whately, Laurence Fox, Anna Massey, Clare Holman and Sian Thomas

Dutch pilot Tim is also feeling the love, as a bromance begins to blossom

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition continues in and around Brighton, as Dutch pilot Tim draws on his travel experience to produce an international menu. After a turbulence-free day in the kitchen, Tim continues to charm his guests, especially DJ Guy

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.desc: Hospitality obsessive Tom hosts the group at his Three Cliffs Bay Holiday Park in Gower, Swansea which offers glamping yurts and caravan stays. programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: The Great House Giveaway

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Farmers daughter Mandy Sowray and her friend Anny Harrison host first at Laskill Country House in Helmsley, North Yorkshire. During the afternoons hay-bale race, youngsters Charlie Thompson and Lauren Tucker from the Abbey Hotel fail to stack up to the challenge. At dinner, Mandy bigs up her banger qualifications, but at breakfast she fails to crack Chriss order. Colins feedback leaves unanswered questions for Mandy

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Chris Witton and his spiritual friend Rammy hope that straightforward value for money will win them the competition, as they host at the Swan Hotel in Telford. A Yorkshire pudding-making competition leaves confident cooks Mandy and Anny thinking theres more to youngsters Charlie and Lauren than meets the eye. At dinner, Rammy opens up about his troubled past. Colin has a rude awakening in the morning. At feedback time, Chris has a change of heart about some of his guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Colin Warburg and his student son Ben hope that their 81-room country pile - Scalford Hall Hotel in Melton Mowbray, Leicestershire - will wow their rivals. However, Chris and Rammy are still smarting from their feedback and think that Colin is playing games. After an afternoon crate stacking competition on the hotels high wire course, Colin gets a grilling at dinner. A lukewarm reaction to breakfast only adds to Colins woes and when he sees his feedback he suspects that retribution is at hand

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to the Abbey Hotel in Battle, East Sussex, run by confident young colleagues Charlie Thompson and Lauren Tucker. However when Charlie and Laurens guests arrive, Colin and Ben feel the squeeze and Chris and Rammy find themselves in a sticky situation. On an afternoon at the archery range, scores are settled. At dinner, straight-talking Chris cant help but be impressed, but when the conversation turns to parking, the guests are in a jam with their hosts. Later, Colins feedback leaves Lauren wanting answers

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The BandB owners meet up to settle some scores. Laskill Country House host Mandy wants to crack where she went wrong with breakfast and why Colin and Ben failed to connect with her, while Chris and Rammy from The Swan Hotel wish to question Lauren on her room flaws and get to the bottom of Colins bedroom nightmares

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend head to east London to take on a 1964 Porsche 356, which is, without a shred of a doubt, the worst car they have ever taken on. In spite of its almost terminal condition, underneath all that rust and rot lies an automotive legend, as the 356 was the car that really launched Porsche overnight into the high-end sports car market

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Master mechanic Fuzz Townshend and parts-blagging petrolhead Tim Shaw head to Co Durham to secretly fix-up an Austin Healey for John, who has Parkinsons disease - and set out to make his classic car dreams come true

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: Angel discovers that the chateau has a vast attic space running the length of the building and rising to the ridge of the roof. While Dick is glad to have some more storage space, Angel has bigger plans - transforming it into a space-inspired bar complete with balconies from which they can watch the stars. programme.title: The Dog House Australia
programme.desc: Jan and Warren are looking for a pet to join them on their caravan adventures, while Karen and her daughter Edie meet gentle and energetic Border collie Parmigiana

programme.title: The Dog House

Nicola and Matt are a couple with very different dogs in mind - so its down to Woodgreen to find the lucky pooch they can both agree on

programme.title: Sailing The Shipping Forecast With the Rev Richard Coles
programme.desc: Writer, radio presenter and musician the Rev Richard Coles marks 100 years of the shipping forecast by travelling round the coasts of the UK and meeting people on and offshore whose lives depend on the weather and sea. He starts his journey sampling the good life in Lundy before finding his sea legs with a Port Isaac fisherman. In Wales, he discovers unique lamb farmed on a saltmarsh and relives his childhood years at the seaside. Richard then travels to the heart of the forecast area - the island that gave it its name - to explore Lundys incredible wildlife tGhat thrives in its isolation. His journey ends back in Cornwall where he joins homegrown celebrities for a sea shanty in the harbour

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: Karan is rushed to St Georges by ambulance after being tackled in a football match, leaving the 24-year-old with fractured bones in his leg. Will has a painful swelling on his head due to an infection of his scalp. The 30-year-old shares the story of how his teenage life was suddenly altered after an unprovoked assault. He describes how his brain injury was life-changing, but that its totally altered his outlook on life. Rock music fan Jonathan suffers a broken toe after dropping a wooden chopping board on his foot

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: An 88-year-old woman collapses, and doctors fear she is not getting enough blood to the brain. A law student is treated for a condition that causes his ribs to grow inwardly, and discusses the bullying he has experienced in his life. programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: On a Friday night, the paramedics are called out to a man who has reportedly collapsed in the street and isnt breathing. Paramedics also treat a man lying unconscious in an alleyway surrounded by needles whos taken a drug overdose but refuses to go to hospital, and a four-year-old who has a high temperature and a nasty cough. On the same shift, a man is struggling to breathe with an abnormal heart rhythm and a woman has fallen and cant get up. The paramedics need to make sure she hasnt broken any bones

programme.title: Sailing The Shipping Forecast With the Rev Richard Coles
programme.desc: Writer, radio presenter and musician the Rev Richard Coles marks 100 years of the shipping forecast by travelling round the coasts of the UK and meeting people on and offshore whose lives depend on the weather and sea. He starts his journey sampling the good life in Lundy before finding his sea legs with a Port Isaac fisherman. In Wales, he discovers unique lamb farmed on a saltmarsh and relives his childhood years at the seaside. Richard then travels to the heart of the forecast area - the island that gave it its name - to explore Lundys incredible wildlife tGhat thrives in its isolation. His journey ends back in Cornwall where he joins homegrown celebrities for a sea shanty in the harbour

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: The broadcaster continues his bug-eyed view of the world of creepy-crawlies, revealing how predators defuse the defences of their prey. programme.title: Great Barrier Reef with David Attenborough
programme.desc: Following his visit to the Great Barrier Reef in 1957, naturalist and broadcaster David Attenborough returns and uses the latest filming techniques to unlock the secrets of the natural wonder. In the first edition, he descends beneath the waves at night and uses cutting-edge technology to generate computer scans of the sea floor. He also learns about a complex community of animals, as well as the annual coral spawning, which is responsible for the great diversity in the reef

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Actress Anna Maxwell Martin researches her family tree. Travelling to the small town in Northern Ireland where her father grew up, her understanding of her grandparents - who suffered a heartbreaking family tragedy - is turned on its head. On her mothers side, Anna starts with her grandfather Maxwell, whose name she added to her own to create her stage name. Looking into his childhood, she uncovers a dark history of domestic abuse and family separation. However, she also discovers extraordinary familial solidarity and love that changed the pattern for the generations that followed

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Medical doctors, science broadcasters and identical twins Chris and Xand van Tulleken team up to research their family tree. They grew up surrounded by old paintings and documents commemorating characters from their Dutch ancestry, but despite this wealth of family archive, the twins know little about their heritage. Their journey takes them back to the Netherlands, where they look into the career of sea captain Jan Tulleken, their four-times great-grandfather, a staunch royalist who joined the Dutch navy at 13. But as they trace the story back, they reveal a troubling story

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell investigate the case of Maria Roberts, the daughter of Italian parents who had a happy adoption growing up with an English family, and now hopes to find Gilda, her birth mother. The team also meets Francesca Barnes, who is in the early stages of transitioning from male to female. She was born with the name Paul and given up for adoption as a baby. Francesca is now searching for her mother, Norma, but fears her transition may prove too much of a challenge, and lead to rejection

programme.title: Dog Squad
programme.desc: Diesel is a hearing dog for his teenage owner, Rayane, who is deaf. This means he doesnt hear everything. Diesel is trained to listen out for important sounds that Rayane might miss. Diesel is Rayanes ears. Together, theyre unstoppable! Diesel and Rayane are off to the park, where their football team are doing a sponsored fun run to raise the funds for a new kit. Diesel has a busy day ahead. First, he has to filter out all the sounds in the busy park to help Rayane find his friends Grace and Karim and the rest of his teammates at the start line. Then, he has to listen for the klaxon so he can let Rayane know the race is starting. He doesnt want him to get left behind! Rayanes football coach uses British Sign Language to communicate the rules of the race to the runners before they set off. Diesel has to run alongside Rayane and alert him to any danger or to anyone trying to get past. Karim is leading the field until he takes a wrong turn - and Rayane and Diesel set off in hot pursuit. Can they catch their friend and help him finish the race?

programme.desc: Young couple Sean and Jess OTuama from County Limerick are restoring a parochial house in rural County Limerick to its former glory. They plan to do some major structural repairs, tear apart the inside, reveal the original stonework and design their own kitchen and bedrooms. When the couple start peeling back layers of old plasterwork they realise that they have more work on their hands than they envisaged

programme.title: The Life of Brian (Maguire)
programme.desc: The story of renowned artist Brian Maguire, who uses his work to tell the stories of those who have fallen by the wayside and reflect the injustices of the real world. The film follows Maguire as he spends time on the US Mexican border giving workshops to migrants fleeing drug violence and finding the locations in the Arizona desert where undocumented migrants have died from dehydration and starvation. He then processes these experiences in his studios in Dublin and Paris

programme.desc: Two troublemaking teenage brothers sent away for military training by their parents sneak away, and pose as staff at a summer camp for children. They accidentally invoke an ancient curse, and soon have to defend the kids from a horde of zombies. Family comedy horror, starring Dylan Schmid and Aidan Shipley

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Archie decides to turn Jamies room into a nursery, while Lexie becomes convinced there is a ghost in the house after she sees a mysterious figure at the window. Duncan is prompted to take control of his relationship with Irene when she talks about leaving Glenbogle, and Molly is less than impressed with the new neighbour

programme.title: Sunday GAA Live
programme.desc: Midleton v Sarsfields (Throw-in 3.15pm). Damian Lawlor presents coverage of the Cork Hurling Championship Final from Páirc Uí Chaoimh

programme.title: Wild West: Americas Great Frontier
programme.desc: Wildlife in Americas mountain regions, including the Rockies and the Sierra Nevada, areas infamous for extremes of temperature from freezing winters to scorching summers. The programme examines the survival strategies employed by animals including black bears, pikas and bison, as well as parasitic plants. Plus, a look at the challenges faced by these regions human inhabitants, including ranchers leading their cattle on 70-mile journeys

programme.title: Big Cats 24/7
programme.desc: The annual flood arrives in the Okavango Delta, bringing new prey and challenges for the big cats. Gordon Buchanan follows the hungry lion mothers as they hunt buffalo, while eldest cub Mathata learns to avoid this formidable prey. Anna Dimitriadis tracks a skinny young cheetah struggling to catch food in the changing landscape and Brad Bestelink follows a pregnant leopard looking for a den as rising flood waters push dangerous males into her territory

programme.title: The Future of Nature
programme.desc: Glimpse into grasslands where the biggest animal numbers are found, and see how animal life helps to draw down carbon

programme.title: The Americas
programme.desc: A look at the Gulf Coasts extraordinary wildlife, including an alligator teaching hatchlings how to hunt and manatees practicing a rarely filmed courtship ritual. In the Texan thornscrub, rarely seen footage shows a mother ocelot, one of the last remaining in the United States, raising her kittens

programme.title: The Day After Tomorrow
programme.desc: A climatologist warns global warming will soon result in destructive freak weather, or even another ice age. He thinks the world still has time to prepare for the worst, but the crisis happens almost immediately - and as storms, earthquakes and hurricanes strike in terrifying fashion, he races across America to rescue his son from a frozen New York. Disaster thriller, with Jake Gyllenhaal and Dennis Quaid

programme.desc: Chris Thormann must confront the fact that the assailant who shot and blinded him is up for parole - and he might get it

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: At Winterfell, Littlefinger schemes to isolate Sansa, while tensions between Arya and her ssister increase after the discovery of a letter. Jon and his men go beyond the wall to capture a white walker, while Daenerys has to make a tough decision

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Tyrion tries to save Westeros from itself as everyone meets in Kings Landing to discuss the fate of the realm, Sansa confronts Arya, while Sam reaches Winterfell, where he and Bran discover a shocking secret about Jon

programme.title: Task
programme.desc: In the wake of the showdown, the members of the now-disbanded Task Force continue to seek answers. As the Dark Hearts mobilise to cover their tracks, a shocking revelation leads them to a final confrontation

programme.title: Mare of Easttown
programme.desc: The case takes a devastating turn and Mares family and friends process the fall-out while she attempts to find her own way forward

programme.title: The Sopranos
programme.desc: Following the break-up of his marriage, Tony visits his former therapist Dr Melfi in the hope their relationship can become more than just professional, while newlywed Janice decides to keep up a Sunday tradition. Carmela and AJ find themselves unexpectedly communing with nature, a bill causes problems for Christopher, and with several organised crime figures due out on parole, the balance of power in the Soprano family business looks set to alter dramatically. Gritty crime drama, starring James Gandolfini, Edie Falco and Lorraine Bracco

programme.title: Banshee
programme.desc: Alex wrongly holds Proctor responsible for the armoured car heist and blows up a truck of cattle in retaliation. When this doesnt trigger the desired response, his sister Nola steps in and takes the crimelords niece Rebecca hostage, leaving it down to Hood to rescue her. Meanwhile, Siobhan is approached by her violent ex-husband Breece, who presents himself a changed man but later turns up at her house drunk and starts threatening her. Drama, with Antony Starr

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Wall, which has protected the Seven Kingdoms for 8,000 years, has fallen, and the Night Kings army of the dead marches towards Westeros. Meanwhile, Jon and Daenerys arrive in Winterfell, and the Stark children are reunited. Starring Emilia Clarke, Kit Harington and Peter Dinklage

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.sub-title: A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms
programme.desc: After arriving at Winterfell, Jaime Lannister is confronted with the consequences of his past mistakes. Meanwhile, Daenerys learns the truth about her relationship with Jon, Brienne of Tarth becomes a Knight, and the army of the dead approach Winterfell. Starring Emilia Clarke, Kit Harington and Peter Dinklage

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Night King and the army of the dead reach Winterfell, and an epic battle between the living and the dead begins. Starring Emilia Clarke, Kit Harington and Peter Dinklage

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Brixham residents raise money for a statue to commemorate fishermen lost at sea, but Pat Seddons plan to support the cause by participating in a fundraising skydive worries her friends and relatives. Jan Hart goes trawling for scallops, and shares some ancient superstitions

programme.title: Hounds of War
programme.desc: After a mission goes wrong, one of a group of mercenaries is left alive to take revenge for his colleagues. Director Isaac Florentines action thriller, starring Frank Grillo, Rhona Mitra and Robert Patrick

programme.title: Hellboy
programme.desc: A thwarted Nazi experiment lands the Allies with an unexpected visitor from another dimension in the form of a bright-red demon. A secretive US government agency fosters the little devil and he grows up to be its crucial weapon against the forces of darkness - but the re-emergence of the sinister wizard Rasputin proves a challenge even for him. Action fantasy based on the comic-book series, with Ron Perlman, John Hurt, Selma Blair and Karel Roden.

programme.title: Snakes on a Plane
programme.desc: An FBI agent is assigned to protect a witness in the trial of a feared crime boss. However, when they board their flight from Hawaii to Los Angeles, the gangsters henchmen set in motion their plan to smuggle onto the aircraft and then release 450 poisonous snakes. Thriller, starring Samuel L Jackson, Julianna Margulies and Jonathan Phillips

programme.title: Total Recall
programme.desc: A man living in a bleak future years after a nuclear war has fake memories of being a secret agent implanted into his brain. However, the procedure uncovers the fact that he really is a spy with his memory erased, and he is forced to become a fugitive from the totalitarian government. Sci-fi thriller remake, with Colin Farrell, Kate Beckinsale and Jessica Biel

programme.title: Gladiator II
programme.desc: After losing his home, Lucius, the son of a slain Roman General, is forced to enter the Colosseum in an attempt to bring glory back to Rome. Ridley Scotts historical drama sequel, starring Paul Mescal, Pedro Pascal and Denzel Washington, with Connie Nielsen and Derek Jacobi reprising their roles from the first film

programme.title: Justice League
programme.desc: Fuelled by his restored faith in humanity and inspired by Supermans selfless act, Bruce Wayne enlists the help of newfound ally Diana Prince to face an even greater enemy. Together, Batman and Wonder Woman work quickly to find and recruit a team of meta-humans to stand against supervillain Steppenwolf, but despite the help of Aquaman, Cyborg and The Flash, it may already be too late to save the planet. Sci-fi adventure, starring Ben Affleck, Gal Gadot and Henry Cavill

programme.title: Venom: The Last Dance
programme.desc: Journalist Eddie Brock and symbiote partner-in-crime Venom are lying low in Mexico City, on the run for the apparent murder of detective Patrick Mulligan. The cop and his bonded entity, Toxin, are actually alive at the Imperium symbiote containment programme, beneath the Area 51 US Air Force facility in the Nevada desert. Knull, the symbiotes immortal creator, dispatches hunters to locate Venoms hidden power source, the Codex, which can set Knull free to terrorise the multiverse. Fantasy adventure, starring Tom Hardy, Chiwetel Ejiofor, Stephen Graham and Juno Temple

programme.title: The Scorpion King
programme.desc: A ruthless warlord resolves to rid the desert of its few remaining tribes, prompting them to seek the help of a legendary assassin to end the despots reign of terror by destroying his source of power - a beautiful but deadly sorceress. Fantasy action adventure, starring Dwayne Johnson, Steven Brand, Kelly Hu and Michael Clarke Duncan

programme.title: Crank
programme.desc: An assassin faces a race against time when he learns a rival has poisoned him with a drug that will kill him if his heart rate drops below a certain level. As he sets out to take revenge on his enemies, he has to resort to increasingly desperate acts to keep his adrenaline pumping. Action thriller, with Jason Statham, Amy Smart and Jose Pablo Cantillo

programme.title: Shooter
programme.desc: A former Marine sniper is coaxed back into action when government officials need his help to prevent an assassination attempt on the US president. However, the intended target is in fact an African archbishop, and the marksman is set up by double-crossing agents to take the fall, forcing him to go on the run as he fights to clear his name. Action thriller, with Mark Wahlberg, Michael Pena and Danny Glover

programme.title: The Green Hornet
programme.desc: A wealthy playboy inherits a media empire when his father dies. Determined to do some good for a change, he uses his new-found fortune to become a masked crime-fighter. Aided by his chauffeur, who is a kung fu expert and a technical genius, he fights to bring down a powerful gangster. Comic-book adventure, starring Seth Rogen, Jay Chou, Cameron Diaz and Christoph Waltz

programme.title: The Dark Tower
programme.desc: A young lad is transported to a parallel universe where he is caught in a battle between a mysterious gunslinger and a sinister sorcerer. Fantasy adventure based on the Stephen King novels, starring Idris Elba, Matthew McConaughey and Tom Taylor

programme.title: Man of Steel
programme.desc: With the imminent destruction of their home planet approaching, a man and his wife seek to preserve their race by sending their infant son to Earth. The childs spacecraft lands at the farm of Jonathan and Martha Kent, who name him Clark and raise him as their own son. Though his extraordinary abilities have led to the adult Clark living on the fringe of society, he is forced to take a stand to protect his adopted home from a fanatical general from his own world, who intends to wipe out the human race. Sci-fi adventure based on the Superman comic-books, starring Henry Cavill, Amy Adams, Michael Shannon and Russell Crowe

programme.title: The Bricklayer
programme.desc: Former CIA agent Steve Vail is reactivated when an extortionist targets the agency. Director Renny Harlins thriller based on the Noah Boyd novel, starring Aaron Eckhart, Nina Dobrev and Clifton Collins Jr

programme.title: Total Recall
programme.desc: A man living in a bleak future years after a nuclear war has fake memories of being a secret agent implanted into his brain. However, the procedure uncovers the fact that he really is a spy with his memory erased, and he is forced to become a fugitive from the totalitarian government. Sci-fi thriller remake, with Colin Farrell, Kate Beckinsale and Jessica Biel

The cop and his bonded entity, Toxin, are actually alive at the Imperium symbiote containment programme, beneath the Area 51 US Air Force facility in the Nevada desert. programme.desc: A ruthless warlord resolves to rid the desert of its few remaining tribes, prompting them to seek the help of a legendary assassin to end the despots reign of terror by destroying his source of power - a beautiful but deadly sorceress. Fantasy action adventure, starring Dwayne Johnson, Steven Brand, Kelly Hu and Michael Clarke Duncan

programme.title: Superman Returns
programme.desc: The Man of Steel returns to Earth after an absence of several years to find his lost love Lois Lane has moved on with her life. Meanwhile, arch-villain Lex Luthor is out of jail and about to wreak havoc on the world with technology stolen from Supermans home planet of Krypton. Comic-book adventure from X-Men director Bryan Singer, with Brandon Routh, Kevin Spacey, Kate Bosworth and Parker Posey

Leonidas, fearless king of Sparta, leads 300 of his finest warriors into battle against the vast invading armies of the ruler of the Persian empire. As the outnumbered Spartans fight for their country, his queen, Gorgo, tries to rally support for her husband at home. Fantasy action adventure based on Frank Miller and Lynn Varleys comic-book series, starring Gerard Butler, Lena Headey, Dominic West, David Wenham and Rodrigo Santoro

programme.title: Superman IV: The Quest for Peace
programme.desc: The Man of Steel embarks on a mission to destroy every nuclear weapon on the planet. However, his arch-enemy Lex Luthor sees the chance to rid himself of the superhero by creating a deadly radioactive henchman who causes havoc around the world. Comic-book adventure sequel, starring Christopher Reeve, Gene Hackman, Mark Pillow and Margot Kidder

programme.title: The Dark Tower
programme.desc: A young lad is transported to a parallel universe where he is caught in a battle between a mysterious gunslinger and a sinister sorcerer. Fantasy adventure based on the Stephen King novels, starring Idris Elba, Matthew McConaughey and Tom Taylor

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania
programme.desc: Dracula opens a luxury resort for monsters, to provide a refuge from terrified humans. His cosy sanctuary is disrupted when a normal man unwittingly checks in, and the situation is complicated when the unwanted guest takes a liking to the counts daughter. Animated comedy, with the voices of Adam Sandler and Andy Samberg

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania 2
programme.desc: Dracula is worried that his half-human grandson is not showing any vampiric tendencies, so enlists the help of his fellow monsters in showing the youngster how it is done. The count is shocked to receive an unwelcome visit from his own father, who does not approve of his sons tolerance of humans. Animated comedy, with the voices of Adam Sandler and Andy Samberg

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania 3: A Monster Vacation
programme.desc: Count Dracula and company participate in a cruise for sea-loving monsters, unaware that their boat is being commandeered by the monster-hating Van Helsing family. Animated sequel, featuring the voices of Adam Sandler, Andy Samberg and Selena Gomez
