programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Callum returns to work, determined to uncover the truth about the rape allegation that blackened his dead fathers name as a police officer and divided the family for 20 years. Kirsty is shocked by the sergeants brusque attitude in handling a vulnerable witness, and Smithy eventually realises his troubled colleague will stop at nothing to get a result against a knife-wielding blackmailer. Guest starring Lesley Vickerage (The Inspector Lynley Mysteries) and David Schofield (Pirates of the Caribbean)

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part series finale, a 14-year-old dies in Smithys arms following a stabbing incident, and CCTV footage reveals he had been acting as a mule for the older members of a gang. One of Mickeys informants is spotted at the crime scene and eventually gives vital evidence pointing to the most likely culprit, but the detective fears for her safety when she is released on bail and returns to the estate

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Conclusion of the two-part series finale, bringing to an end Britains longest-running police procedural drama, which has been broadcast in 55 countries. The show, which began life as one-off drama Woodentop in 1984, broke new ground by exploring the lives and loves of the officers of the fictional London station of Sun Hill. Callum finally proves himself to Smithy as they hunt the members of the Parkway Crew responsible for the death of Liam Martin, and Mickey goes all-out to get justice for his informant Jasmine Harris following the gang rape

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Feature-length special of the police drama. Rookie PC Fox agrees to help a CID investigation by going undercover as a prostitute. Santini reckons she isnt cut out for such an assignment _ does he have an ulterior motive for being so protective toward her? Michael Higgs and Caroline Catz star, with Hilton McRae, Libby Davison and Shaun Scott

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Skase and Proctor are led a merry dance by an over-eager witness, while Santini tries every trick in the book to make it up with Fox - only to be met by the threat of a formal complaint to the Police Federation. Michael Higgs and Caroline Catz star as the warring coppers

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives move into their new premises following the explosion that wrecked the old Nonnatus House, and are joined by fresh arrival Sister Winifred - a kindly-but-naive young woman. Jenny becomes concerned about new mother Merles mental state and the welfare of her baby, who isnt feeding properly. Dr Turner believes it could be something more serious - although the mystery is eventually solved by the last person anyone would have expected. Chummy is struggling to adjust to her new role as a housewife and mother, and organises an open day at the community centre. Jessica Raine, Stephen McGann and Miranda Hart star

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixies feathers are ruffled when Jenny is promoted, but the new Acting Sister has more to worry about after a mother-to-be reveals the baby she is carrying was not fathered by her husband - and to complicate matters, the real father is black. Cynthia is inspired by a lecture on natural childbirth, convinced it will help an overly anxious patient, while Alec and his friends try to persuade Jenny to join them on a CND march. Jessica Raine, Helen George and Bryony Hannah star in the 1950s-set nursing drama

programme.title: Catherine Cooksons The Gambling Man
programme.desc: Robson Green stars in the title role as Rory Connor, a rent collector who spends his nights at the gaming tables, secure in the knowledge that nobody can turn a card quite like him. Unfortunately, as the stakes get higher, Connor finds himself gambling more than money - with dramatic consequences for himself and those around him. Feature-length drama, with Bernard Hill and Sylvestra Le Touzel

programme.title: Last Tango in Halifax
programme.desc: Celia and Alan continue their unconventional romance by buying an expensive convertible car instead of an engagement ring. But they do throw a party, where they reveal the reason they never got together 60 years earlier - and who it was that stood in their way. Michael Dobson tries to blackmail Caroline over her relationship with Kate, and although she easily gets rid of him, its clear she is uneasy about anyone finding out the truth. Meanwhile, Gillian is worried Raff will discover how his father died from Robbie - so decides to make a confession. Sally Wainwrights light-hearted drama, starring Derek Jacobi, Anne Reid, Sarah Lancashire and Nicola Walker

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: Great Slaughter is buzzing with excitement for the annual talent show, which has a huge cash prize and a celebrity judge. However, the excitement turns to panic when an egotistical magician is killed during his act. Rather than an accident, Sister Boniface suspects murder. John Thomson guest stars, with Lorna Watson

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Leo visits old college friend Sean Delaney at his psychiatric care centre in Essex, where one of the patients has been found dead in her bed. Although the coroner ruled a verdict of sudden-death syndrome, Delaney is not convinced and asks Leo to investigate. Suspicion soon falls on the dead girls father, who has lost the family fortune, and his wife - but the pathologist runs into problems when the local detective sergeant makes it clear she is suspicious of his motives. Adrian Dunbar, Tamzin Outhwaite and Tom Ellis guest star

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team tracks vicious criminal Chopper Hadley, who is back in the country for a week, with Brian going undercover to apprehend the villain. Patrick Malahide (The Inspector Alleyn Mysteries) guest stars, with Dennis Waterman, James Bolam and Alun Armstrong

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixies feathers are ruffled when Jenny is promoted, but the new Acting Sister has more to worry about after a mother-to-be reveals the baby she is carrying was not fathered by her husband - and to complicate matters, the real father is black. Cynthia is inspired by a lecture on natural childbirth, convinced it will help an overly anxious patient, while Alec and his friends try to persuade Jenny to join them on a CND march. Jessica Raine, Helen George and Bryony Hannah star in the 1950s-set nursing drama

programme.title: Kingdom
programme.desc: The first-ever episode of the drama, starring Stephen Fry. Following the mysterious disappearance six months previously of his brother and business partner Simon, Peter Kingdom collects his belongings from the police station. Although he is still mourning his loss, life for the respected small-town solicitor must go on. With Hermione Norris and Celia Imrie

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Rights of Man (Except for Howard)
programme.desc: Hobbo tells Howard to stand up for himself if he still wants Pearl to take him back - but his wife pours cold water on his attempts to impress her. Marina decides to seize the moment with Mr Waddle, and the police pull Tom over for driving too slowly, only to end up sharing his bacon sandwiches. Russ Abbot, Robert Fyfe and Juliette Kaplan star

programme.title: Spooks

programme.desc: Crime scene cleaner Wicky faces the ultimate test of self-control - a job in a pub just after hes promised his new girlfriend to stay off the booze. However, this proves to be the least of his problems when he is called upon to handle the devastation left by a lethal barroom brawl. As a web of romantic and criminal intrigue slowly unravels around him, he realises theres more to this job than just cleaning up blood and gore. Dark comedy, starring Greg Davies, with Harriet Walter and Charlie Rawes

programme.title: The Cleaner
programme.desc: Crime scene cleaner is called to a theatre, where a male strip show has got out of hand, resulting in a 40-woman brawl. However, a blood-splattered auditorium is the least of his problems when a self-important clown, a whimsical theatre manager, a feckless assistant and a broken fire alarm all combine to create a nightmare day at work. Dark comedy, starring Greg Davies, with Simon Callow

programme.title: Toast of London
programme.desc: Tired of doing voiceover work and appearing on stage every night, Steven hires a new agent and tries his hand at a different career - an author of erotic literature. He also finds himself a glamorous woman, who would be perfect for him if only they could find a moment in private. Comedy, starring Matt Berry

programme.desc: Manic flatmates Eddie and Richie are marooned on a desert island - with only a nuclear bomb for company

programme.title: The Cleaner
programme.desc: Wicky is called to a shooting in a technology shop, where he finds himself sharing the night shift with a shelf-stacking conspiracy theorist who is preparing for the end of the world - which he insists is just around the corner. Wicky isnt sure whether the man is paranoid or just being sensible, but either way he has to decide where his own priorities lie. Dark comedy, starring Greg Davies, with Asim Chaudhry

programme.title: The Cleaner
programme.desc: Wicky is called to a stately home for his latest cleaning task. Hes not the only person at the mansion with a job to do - theres a shaman on the scene as well, and he has his own mystical agenda. Wickys not sure theres room enough for both of them - and after an owl and possibly a ghost are factored into the mix, things are looking positively crowded. Dark comedy, starring Greg Davies, with Alex Lawther

programme.title: Toast of London
programme.desc: After losing £20,000 to Andrew Lloyd Webber in a celebrity game of poker, Steven is pursued by musical superstar and part-time enforcer Michael Ball (playing himself). Then, the actors problems mount when hes caught in bed with Ray Purchases wife, leading to a showdown with both men on stage. If he survives, theres good news in store, as agent Jane thinks he may have won the role of James Bond. With Tracy-Ann Oberman

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A mother-to-be with a major heart defect who thought she would never have children enters the final stages of pregnancy. Her waters break the day before the due date, but when she does not go into labour, the midwives decide to induce her. Meanwhile, a woman with an overwhelming fear of pain is nervous about the arrival of her third baby

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A father-to-be does all he can to support his wife through her carefully planned hypno-birth, while another is unaware that labour has begun for his firstborn because he is locked behind bars. Meanwhile, a couple defy those who tell them they are too young to start a family

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A 17-year-old mother-to-be is determined to have a natural birth, but struggles to cope with the pain, and midwife Amy Bisson discusses the extra challenges involved in caring for teenage patients. Meanwhile, a 37-year-old woman progresses through her labour with ease, finding that laughter is the best medicine

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A woman prepares to give birth to twins, but a scan shows a problem with one of the babies, meaning it will need to go to the special care unit as soon as it is born. Meanwhile, a mother-of-one, who has experienced the trauma of a stillbirth and a newborn dying, goes into labour

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The staff at Southamptons Princess Anne Maternity Hospital are put on alert as an influx of expectant mothers causes a shortage of beds - and the workload soon threatens to overwhelm the midwives and anaesthetists on duty. Among the patients is Amy, whose previous four conceptions all miscarried, and two women whose blood pressure levels need to be constantly monitored

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick faces one of his greatest practical and ethical challenges yet when hes introduced to Hermes, a tortoise with only one good leg. Can he provide Hermes with three prosthetic feet, using tiny titanium implants? Meanwhile, a rottweiler called Dave urgently needs an upgrade to his previous hip replacements

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A small cavachon is rushed to see Professor Noel Fitzpatrick after being hit by a car. She has a broken leg, but also a serious heart condition. Meanwhile, Simba, a one-year-old Labrador needs help with her badly formed hips, and Tulee the nervous basset hound has diseased discs in her back that leave her in constant pain

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing and TOWIE star Pete Wicks immerses himself in the heart-warming and emotional world of dog care at Basildons Dogs Trust rehoming centre. Pete returns to Dogs Trust, facing a suitcase of abandoned pups on day one and falling hard for Theo, a gentle Italian Mastiff with a serious heart condition.

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Its New Years Eve, one of the busiest days for the West Midlands crews. Gaz and Liam help a man whose celebrations were cut short when he was hit in the head by a firework

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: As the New Year starts Simon and Fiona are called to a pregnant woman who is bleeding, while Joe and Hannah race to a young woman who has been self-harming

programme.title: Inside the Operating Theatre
programme.desc: Lyn has an investigation of her womb after a recent biopsy revealed abnormal cells and Steve is worried about only getting a local anaesthetic before his varicose veins are removed

programme.title: Inside the Operating Theatre
programme.desc: Julia has a camera investigation of her womb to find out the reason for her heavy bleeding and Emma has a section of bone removed from her foot to cure a painful condition

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Nicola and Tim, who are both nurses, hope their second childs birth will be less dramatic than their first, who was born after an emergency C-section. Expectant mum Laura, 29, has battled anorexia nervosa since she was a teenager and was told she would never be able to have children because of the impact of her eating disorder. However, she and partner Delroy are now looking forward to the arrival of baby number three. Tracy is days past her due date and her little one is refusing to make an appearance

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Its all hands on deck as Southmead Hospitals maternity ward reaches maximum capacity, and the midwives are concerned that the unit may have to close. Among the new arrivals are Mormon couple Jennie and Jon, who are expecting their third child, and nervous first-time parents Eve and Andy, who experienced difficulties during their two previous pregnancies

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The designers fly solo this week, giving them a chance to demonstrate their individual abilities as they transform shepherd huts into boutique boltholes on a glampsite in north Wales. The client is a brand-new business so they have a blank canvas to work on, and having been given individual briefs by Michelle Ogundehin, each designer takes a different approach to turning these tiny spaces into luxury living accommodation, with the challenge of an en-suite shower room and an outdoor space thrown in for good measure. What will Michelle and guest judge Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen make of the end results?

programme.title: Amanda and Alans Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden purchases two dilapidated apartments nestled in the sun-kissed hills of rural Sicily, intending to raise them from their ruins and create luxury holiday homes. The hope is that she and workmate friend Alan Carr to make a huge profit they can donate to charity. After arriving at the crumbling property for the first time, the piles of rubbish and abandoned junk suggest to both that that this visit will be no holiday

programme.title: Nick Knowles Big House Clearout
programme.desc: The presenter heads to Hastings to meet Mike, who lives in a small two-up two-down cottage with his four rescue dogs. Mike developed hip problems, has become more housebound, and clutter has been building up around him. Nicks team empty the home and give it a much-needed makeover, turning a cramped dark cottage into a welcoming airy space

programme.desc: Jen and Alexs 1940s LA home is full of character and still has some of the original features, but its closed-off layout is no longer functioning for the growing family

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: The Scott brothers renovate a beachside home in Marina del Ray for owners Tammy and Dimiter

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: Kimberli and Sheldons home has been in his family for three generations, but some original features need to make way for modern life and their two little ones

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team head to Barnstaple in Devon to help Jan and Lucy, whose daily four-hour round trips to hospital for life-saving dialysis treatment for two of their daughters is taking a heavy toll on family life. Along with designer Laurence Llewelyn Bowen and hundreds of local volunteers, Nick and the crew extend their house to create a home dialysis centre, enabling the girls to be treated where they live and letting the whole family settle into a healthier and happier routine

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team head to Bangor in Co Down to help Mandy McCreight, who is isolated in her bedroom due to a variety of medical issues and is missing out on family life. Her children Ben and Kara also have mobility problems, while husband Davey looks after everyone, but now he is suffering from a back injury. The entire family are under real stress and the house is not wheelchair friendly, making the situation unbearable

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: The team are in Corby, Northamptonshire, to complete a build for Jackie and Colin Hutchison and their three children. The eldest, Jordan, has cerebral palsy and epilepsy - but this has not stopped him raising huge sums of money for charity. However, he and his family are currently living with his grandmother after a after a series of building issues left them without the money to complete their own home renovation. As ever, Nick Knowles and the team, plus hundreds of local workers, arrive to change this familys life in just a few short days

programme.title: MasterChef Australia
programme.desc: Its elimination day for the Top 4, and the contestants must gamble on an ingredient to prepare either a sweet or savoury dish

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Food writer Nigella Lawson demonstrates dishes that combine the comfort of the familiar with the excitement of the new, including fluffy oat pancakes drizzled with a raspberry and honey syrup. She offers a twist on a classic Caesar salad for a light lunch idea, and rustles up a Greek-inspired supper for friends including squid and orzo pasta, and a sweet and savoury version of a cheesecake. Nigellas simple rice bowl with ginger, radish and avocado celebrates a few choice ingredients and results in a dish thats uplifting to look at, as well as to eat

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.sub-title: Terri, Esme and the Chi Family
programme.desc: Pete meets Lurcher Terri, whos terrified of the world and must learn to trust again, and helps settle a family of chihuahuas given up by their heartbroken owner

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick offers cutting-edge treatment for Luca, a long-suffering four-year-old springer spaniel with a painful elbow disease. He designs and creates a special screw for Lucas leg with a system for injecting a bone-growth gel around it, and after an eight-year-old Newfoundland collapses, its owners face an agonising wait for the MRI scans to reveal if anything can be done for the gentle giant

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Rescue Labrador Tom needs work with a serious wound on one of his front paws, and four-year-old French bulldog called Otis has suffered an accident while being chased by another dog. Professor Noel Fitzpatrick diagnoses a spinal problem high up in Otiss neck that requires surgery. Meanwhile, Bailey, a 10-year-old cocker spaniel, has quite a lot of pain in one of his hind limbs, but his owner wants to avoid surgery, and Noel needs to perform specialist imaging before he can offer any solutions

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Return of the documentary capturing daily life on the busy maternity ward in Southmead Hospital, Bristol. Mel, 35, is expecting fourth-generation twins and when her waters break, the expectant mum has to choose whether husband Chris or her identical twin sister Cheryl will be her birthing partner. Larger-than-life Su, 36, felt she had hit the jackpot when she met younger man Dan, 28, and the couple arrive at Southmead in high spirits. Their baby is in breech so the couple have been booked for a Caesarean - but their plans soon change. Meanwhile, Rob is praying for a son as partner Katy is rushed to the delivery suite

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The contestants pair up to redesign cafes in the seaside town of Margate, with each person responsible for their own zone. One team decide that art deco is the way to go and choose a very bold colour palette, inspired by one of Margates most famous artists, JW Turner. The other team channel the colours of the sea with cool blues and vintage shutters to create a laid-back feel. But which one will impress Michelle Ogundehin and guest judge Ross Bailey the most? Presented by Alan Carr

programme.title: Amanda and Alans Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden and Alan Carr take on their first project - designing a Sicilian kitchen. Kicking off the demolition in 36-degree heat proves to be a trial for Alan, and he soon realises that taking on a build in a medieval hilltop town comes with its own unique challenges. With the help of Project Manager Scott, Amanda barters with the locals at a nearby marble factory as she bags a bargain for their feature island and brushes up on her culinary skills in Marsala, learning how to cook Sicilys signature dish

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillos rail voyage continues through Connecticut heading north through the scenic New England states. In New Haven, a crash course in rowing takes place on a stretch of water where college teams from Yale and Harvard have battled for victory since 1852. Making tracks north to Vermont, Michael experiences 19th-century rural farm life, when its green pastures made it the butter capital of the world

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: In Montreal, Michael Portillo discovers how French and British colonial roots have influenced the citys construction, cuisine and culture. Undaunted by his guidebooks description of the treacherous Lachine Rapids, the one-time MP gets a thorough soaking on a white-knuckle boat ride down the St. Lawrence River. In the Canadian capital, Ottawa, Michael visits the countrys parliament to hear about the birth of the new nation after Confederation in 1867. And at Ottawas historic Central Experimental Farm, Michael hears of the pioneering discoveries, which launched a Canadian wheat boom

programme.title: Great Indian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillos Bradshaws 1913 Handbook of Indian, Foreign and Colonial Travel leads him on railway journey through the modern south Indian states of Karnataka and Tamil Nadu. He travels from the former princely state of Mysuru, aka Mysore, to the first stronghold of the East India Company in Chennai, formerly Madras

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: A vital chain gives way on the Ocean Ventures nets and Barry Lauder has to think quickly to save the day. Meanwhile on the Amity, skipper Jimmy Buchan ignores the concerns of his first mate and enters the jagged contours of the Ooze Hole to fish for prawns

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: The skipper of one of the smallest boats in the Peterhead fleet must decide whether to head back to harbour or brave the treacherous sea following a severe weather warning. Two trawlers who fish as a pair risk disaster as they cast their shared nets on stormy waters, and James Thores desperation to find haddock sees him act on a potentially costly hunch

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: A new £12million pelagic boat presents trouble for Willie and Peter Tait when its state-of-the-art communications system breaks down. Meanwhile, James Buchan finds his cheaper method, using a delicate seine net, has its own risks as he searches for fish among wrecks on the seabed

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: There is a triple collection of desirable cars in store for Derek when an MG Midget, an Austin-Healey frogeye Sprite and an RS2000 come up for auction

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Daves son Jack heads to Cheshire to collect two cars with a 35-year age difference, and luckily for Mathewsons, Lucy knows exactly whats been brought in for auction

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team send their Paul Smith Mini in for a bit of designer tailoring by the team at Mini Sport

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: British car enthusiasts Will and Gus lay their hands on a potentially very valuable Volvo. Its great to look at, but doesnt start easily and cannot stop, requiring an overhaul of the ignition and breaks

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals how mammals dominate the planet and survive in extreme habitats. In the Antarctic, a lone Weddell seal wears its teeth down keeping an ice hole open to catch fish for its pup. In warmer climes, the gerbil-like rufous sengi demonstrates impressive speed to avoid reptilian predators, giant bats feast on fruit trees in Zambia and male humpback whales battle for a female

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: The focus turns to fish, the most diverse vertebrates on the planet, made up of more than 28,000 species. Off the coast of South Australia, sea dragons pair up for courtship, engaging in a mirror dance before the eggs are laid on the males tail. Gobies climb up the vertical rocks of Hawaiian waterfalls to access secluded pools at the summit, and flying fish use their elongated pectoral fins to escape from predators. Narrated by David Attenborough

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: The focus turns to birds, revealing the role of their feathers, the ways in which they attract partners and the challenges they face during the nesting season. Narrator David Attenborough provides an insight into the courtship spectacle of the lesser flamingo on Kenyas Lake Bogoria, and follows chinstrap penguins in Antarctica, which make an exhausting climb up a volcano to feed their young

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: The focus turns to insects, whose key to success is an armoured covering that takes on almost any shape. Bombardier beetles fire boiling liquid at enemies through a rotating nozzle, while a honey bee army stings a raiding bear into submission. Grass-cutter ants march like a Roman army and cultivate a fungus to break down the grass they have harvested. Narrated by David Attenborough

programme.title: Turkey with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The first of two programmes in which the presenter explores the country that lies at the crossroads between Europe and Asia, and discovers the dramatic changes it is undergoing. The first leg of his journey begins in Istanbul, from which he travels along the Aegean coast to the hostile border with Syria. He meets refugees trying to start a new life and a billionaire taking advantage of a property boom. He moves on into the Taurus Mountains and the Black Sea Coast, and visits a community trying to keep an ancient language alive

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: British car enthusiasts Will and Gus lay their hands on a potentially very valuable Volvo. Its great to look at, but doesnt start easily and cannot stop, requiring an overhaul of the ignition and breaks

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team send their Paul Smith Mini in for a bit of designer tailoring by the team at Mini Sport

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: There is a triple collection of desirable cars in store for Derek when an MG Midget, an Austin-Healey frogeye Sprite and an RS2000 come up for auction

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Daves son Jack heads to Cheshire to collect two cars with a 35-year age difference, and luckily for Mathewsons, Lucy knows exactly whats been brought in for auction

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A 1970 Excalibur Roadstar, once owned by Roy Orbison, arrives at Thornton-le-Dale and Derek heads to County Durham to collect a 1935 Austin 7 Ulster

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Two iconic classics find their way to the Mathewsons auction room. Dave heads to north Manchester to pick up an Austin A30 and a Morris 8E thats had an alternative paint job

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: An impressive collection of five iconic cars arrives at Thornton le Dale, including a 1967 Crayford Corsair and a 1966 Ford Zodiac which emerge from a garage in Selby

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo leaves the tracks for a nautical pilgrimage through the Thousand Islands, visiting Fort Henry in the port city of Kingston, Ontario, and learning about the antics of 19th-century high-wire walker the Great Farini in Port Hope. He then heads to Oshawa to look around the home of the McLaughlin family, who helped build a new economy for Canada, before his journey across Canada concludes in Toronto

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo returns to explore more of the US rail network, embarking on the first leg of a journey across Alaska. He begins his journey amid the snow-capped mountains of the Kenal Peninsula, where he discovers that 150 years ago, Alaska was a Russian colony. Moving on, in Seward he feeds a rescued sea otter with a fearsome bite and in Anchorage he joins the US Arctic Warriors for parachute training

programme.desc: A rare 1980s Sierra Cosworth draws in a crowd of admiring Ford fans, while a restorer delights buyers with his immaculate 1966 Sunbeam Rapier and Sarah takes a shine to a caravan

programme.desc: A chilling discovery in the furthest reaches of Eastern Canada hints at the true depths of the Nazis seafaring capabilities

programme.title: The Great War in Numbers
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the First World War through numbers, beginning with a look at the growth of empires in the years leading up to 1914 and the fatal first shot

programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Burton Constable Hall near Hull, which is home to a collection of treasures. Objects brought in to be valued include a ships anchor that was found in a garden pond, a medal awarded to sailor for helping to recover Captain Scotts ship from the Antarctic in 1901, some 17th-century flat pack furniture, and a flimsy booklet that proved to be a profitable investment

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow

programme.title: Burma with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Part one of a two-part documentary exploring the country in the aftermath of the recent humanitarian crisis in which thousands of Rohingya Muslims were driven from their homes by the military. Simon visits Burmas Buddhist heartlands, including the ancient capital of Bagan, and meets the citys controversial nationalist monks. While the region affected by the military crackdown is off limits, he is able to visit the worlds biggest refugee camp in Bangladesh, and meet people traumatised by the violence

programme.title: Indian Ocean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The adventurer begins the final leg of his journey on the northern tip of Sumatra in western Indonesia, near the epicentre of the 2004 Boxing Day tsunami, finding out how the province of Banda Aceh has undergone many changes since the disaster. He also explores the illegal trade in exotic pets in the Indonesian capital of Jakarta, before heading for Australia, the final country on his epic journey. There he visits the unspoilt wilderness of the Kimberley region, meets a crocodile hunter and goes fishing with natives campaigning to stop the construction of a giant gas plant

programme.title: The Lakes with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The adventurer explores the wild and rugged coast of Cumbria and learns how central the county is to many of the challenges facing Britain. He visits Sellafield, which is home to hundreds of ageing and disused nuclear facilities and meets people tasked with clearing and securing more than half a century of Britains nuclear waste

programme.title: Hospital
programme.desc: The documentary charting the day-to-day realities faced by workers in the NHS returns, picking up with staff at St Marys Hospital in London on March 22nd 2017, the day of the Westminster terror attack. St Marys is one of the capitals four Major Trauma Centres, and staff are well-versed in Major Incident Protocols that come into effect in the wake of events such as terrorist activity. Arrangements are made to transfer some of the hospitals critically ill patients to a sister site at Charring Cross, giving the AandE team more scope to help the victims, including teenagers Yann and Victor; French students in London on a school trip. Also admitted is Stephen, who needs immediate surgery to save his leg, and his wife Cara shares her thoughts on the helplessness felt by the families of those most gravely injured as a result of these incidents

programme.desc: Brian Dowling and his fashion-forward design team continue their mission to prove to the nation that it is possible achieve a dream home renovation at little cost. Changing Rooms meets the Repair Shop with a new sustainable twist, the challenge here is to transform our bland old rooms, furniture and fittings into unique and stunning show stoppers, using only upcycling and sustainable methods. This is the home makeover format for the world we live in today, as two households per week, each with a team consisting of an interior designer and an up-cycling wiz, have just four days and 1,000 euro to renovate and rejuvenate a tired spaces in their home, filling them with home-made, re-used and revamped furnishings. programme.title: Ainsleys National Trust Cook Off
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott is joined by chefs Daniel Galmiche and Ruby Bhogal at the Wimpole Estate in Cambridgeshire to see who can create and cook the Dish of the Day this time. Ainsley digs up some spuds for his quick flatbread pizza with Charlotte potatoes, rosemary and chilli rings, Daniel brings his French fervour to a pork chop with courgette, tomatoes and cavolo nero, and Ruby celebrates her Indian heritage with her mothers Indian spiced lamb kebab rolls with onion, mint, chilli and coriande

programme.title: Judi Loves Culinary Cruise
programme.desc: The presenter visits Kefalonia, largest of the Greek islands and a place known for its pies. Judi visits a family run restaurant, where Mirela makes the famous kreatopita pie for her, gets crafty with a Kefalonian tradition, and meets Kostas at his vineyard. She also makes a spinach, feta and walnut parcel with a tomato salad

programme.title: Titanic
programme.desc: The story of RMS Titanic is retold in this epic drama by Downton Abbey writer Julian Fellowes, weaving fictional and historical characters into the action. Southampton docks, April 1912, and people from all walks of life board the White Star Lines gleaming new liner for its maiden voyage to New York, from aristocrats and holidaying celebrities to steerage passengers and crew members dreaming of a better life in America. Friendships are made and conflicts arise - but then the unsinkable vessel collides with an iceberg, and none of their lives will ever be the same again. Linus Roache, Toby Jones, Geraldine Somerville and Steven Waddington star

programme.title: Finders Keepers

Martin and Ashley suspect Rocky is behind it all and a visit to see him confirms he is not to be messed with. Rocky ensures them both that failure to give him the money he is owed will have even more frightening repercussions. Now all Martin needs to do is find the cash - and fast

John Thaw stars with his real-life wife Sheila Hancock, Josette Simon, Lisa Harrow and Tom Brodie

programme.title: Judge Rinders Crime Stories
programme.desc: Barrister Robert Rinder examines the case of Edith Negus from Bridlington, East Yorkshire. Edith died in October 2014 at the age of 102, but it was only after her death that her family discovered she was conned out of nearly £290,000 by Julie Sayles, her carer. Sayles bought two houses with money she took from a bank account she shared with Edith, and after being found out, was jailed for nine years in June 2017

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Helen is accused of helping an elderly, terminally ill patient to die, a problem compounded by the strain of concealing her relationship with Rob. Rural drama, with Sophie Ward, Jonathan Kerrigan, Gwen Taylor, David Lonsdale and Steven Blakeley

programme.desc: Ruth Watson is faced with her toughest challenge yet when she visits 15-bedroom Georgian guest house Blossoms in the centre of York. The owners cost-cutting has led to complaints, the staff are in need of intense customer service training, and the decor is outdated. The hospitality guru believes she can turn the business around - but only if the hotelier loosens the purse strings

programme.sub-title: All the Fun of the Fair
programme.desc: The residents are pleased when a fair comes to Elsinby, but Jeffrey and Samantha have their work cut out when the waltzer operator becomes trapped in the rides mechanism. Hes rushed to the hospital, where Mr Rose operates, and reveals his father has been suffering dizzy spells recently. A concerned Jeffrey heads back to the fairground, but hes too late to prevent disaster. Meanwhile, Ken hatches a dubious money-making scheme and Jill is forced to confront a patients wife. programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: An idyllic summer day in Oxford is torn asunder when a parcel bomb claims the life of eminent mathematician Adam Capstone, a genius in the field of `Knot Theory". As Lewis and Hathaway investigate, they discover that, while the victims academic reputation was beyond reproach, his private life was far more dubious. It emerges Capstone was a man of carnal appetites, who had a string of affairs with young students, betraying his chemistry professor wife Elizabeth, providing her with a clear motive to do away with her cheating spouse. As the detectives work to identify the killer bomber, the case becomes a personal challenge for Lewis, who fears he may not be rewarded with another contract should he fail to impress Moody before his six-month trip to New Zealand. Detective drama, starring Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox, with Zoe Tapper, Tristam Summers and Oliver Lansley
